text: Hi all, looking to do some multithreading in julia. I want to run io tasks in the background, seen online to use async for this, though this only performs asynchronous running,  I want the capability to run potentially many async continuous io task in parallel. Looking for something that schedules many async tasks between several threads and switches between them, i.e. not wait for completion of the task before scheduling the next, since they are continuous tasks. Found a lot online about macros that distribute work and then perform a reduction, but not sure the right tools for these continuous tasks where no reduction is performed, or return value given.
